titleInfo.title: In Conformity to the Provisions of an Act.

mods.abstract: IN conformity to the provisions of an act, entitled An Act in relation to Slaves detained in the Police Jails in the Municipalities of NewOrleans, approved March 10, 1846-- Notice is hereby given that the following described person, supposed to be a slave, is confined in the Po-lice Prison of Municipality No. Two: JIM, a light griff, about 18 or 19 years old, 5 feet 3 inches high, has lost the small finger on the right hand at the second joint; says he belongs to Mr. James Robinson, of Memphis, Tennessee. The owner of which is hereby notified thereof, and requested to prove property, pay charges thereon, and take him away within a delay of three months, otherwise he will be sold in conformity to the above law. J. WORRELL, Warden. NewOrleans, November 19, 1851. n20 1aw3w
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
